intro: Bupleurum multinerve, commonly known as the multinerved bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Bupleurum multinerve thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
